The participants also engaged in a discussion of many current issues: the course of construction at the Vostochny Space Launch Centre, the outcomes of a dilapidated housing audit in the Baikal Amur Railway zone and Ukraine’s upcoming ratification of an Association Agreement with the European Union.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had talks with President of the Federative Republic of Brazil Dilma Rousseff within the framework of his official visit to Brazil.

briefs: NA

briefs: Vladimir Putin has met with German Chancellor Angela Merkel in Rio de Janeiro.

title.info: Vladimir Putin has arrived in Brazil on an official visit
briefs: Vladimir Putin has arrived in Rio de Janeiro, where he will attend the closing ceremony of the 2014 FIFA World Cup, during which Russia will take the relay as host country of the next World Cup in 2018.

briefs: An official lunch hosted by President of Argentina Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner in honour of Russian President Vladimir Putin was held in Buenos Aires.

briefs: In the course of his official visit to the Argentine Republic, Vladimir Putin held talks with President of Argentina Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner.

briefs: NA

title.info: Visit to Nicaragua
briefs: The President of Russia made a brief visit to Nicaragua. Vladimir Putin had talks with President of Nicaragua Daniel Ortega in Managua.

briefs: Vladimir Putin held talks with President of the State Council and Council of Ministers of Cuba Raul Castro.

briefs: NA

briefs: Vladimir Putin laid a wreath at the monument to Cuban national hero Jose Marti.

title.info: Meeting with Fidel Castro
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Fidel Castro during his visit to Cuba. Mr Putin and Mr Castro’s conversation lasted approximately one hour.

title.info: Wreath-laying ceremony at the Memorial to Soviet Internationalist Soldiers
briefs: Vladimir Putin began his official visit to Cuba by laying a wreath at the Memorial to Soviet Internationalist Soldiers in the suburbs of Havana. President of the Council of State and Council of Ministers of Cuba Raul Castro took part in the ceremony.

title.info: Global Eco-Forum
briefs: While on a working visit to China, Chief of Staff of the Presidential Executive Office Sergei Ivanov took part in the Global Eco-Forum.

title.info: Vladimir Putin has arrived in Cuba on an official visit
briefs: Vladimir Putin has arrived in Cuba on an official visit at the invitation of President of the Council of State and Council of Ministers of the Republic of Cuba Raul Castro.

title.info: Ratification of an agreement settling Cuba’s debt to Russia
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Federal Law On Ratifying the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Cuba on Settling the Republic of Cuba’s Debt to the Russian Federation for Loans Issued during the Soviet Period.

title.info: Meeting with permanent members of the Security Council
briefs: Vladimir Putin met on Thursday night with permanent members of the Security Council.

title.info: Interview to Prensa Latina and ITAR-TASS
briefs: In view of his visit to Cuba, Argentina and Brazil, Vladimir Putin answered questions from journalists of the Prensa Latina and ITAR-TASS news agencies.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with the Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu at the initiative of the Israeli side.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Angela Merkel and Francois Hollande
briefs: Vladimir Putin, German Federal Chancellor Angela Merkel and President of the French Republic Francois Hollande had a telephone conversation to further discuss the various aspects of the crisis in Ukraine, given the armed operation in the south east of the country and the growing number of Ukrainian refugees on the territory of Russia.

title.info: Meeting with heads of security and intelligence services of CIS states
briefs: Vladimir Putin held a meeting with the heads of delegations to the 13th meeting of the Conference of Heads of CIS Security and Intelligence Services dedicated to intelligence matters.

title.info: Instructions to sign agreements between Russia and Argentina
briefs: The President has signed a number of instructions regarding the execution of agreements between the Russian Federation and the Argentine Republic.

title.info: Meeting with Italian Foreign Minister Federica Mogherini
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Italian Foreign Minister Federica Mogherini.

title.info: Sergei Ivanov’s working visit to China
briefs: The Chief of Staff of the Presidential Executive Office Sergei Ivanov is in China on a working visit. On the first day of the visit, the official met with the President of the People’s Republic of China Xi Jinping and the Head of the Secretariat of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee Li Zhanshu, and visited the Russian Language Centre of the Beijing Foreign Languages University.

title.info: Meeting with Prime Minister of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Prime Minister of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic, who is in Russia on a working visit.

title.info: On July 8, Vladimir Putin will meet with Prime Minister of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic
briefs: Vladimir Putin will meet with Prime Minister of the Republic of Serbia Aleksandar Vucic, who is in Russia on a working visit.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev.

title.info: Vladimir Putin will visit Cuba, Argentina and Brazil on July 11-16
briefs: Vladimir Putin will make a series of visits on July 11-16 to Latin American countries and will take part in BRICS summit, including the BRICS-Latin America meeting planned as part of the summit.

title.info: Congratulations to US President Barack Obama on Independence Day
briefs: Vladimir Putin congratulated President of the United States of America Barack Obama on national holiday - Independence Day.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Angela Merkel and Francois Hollande
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel and President of France Francois Hollande in continuation of discussion on the crisis in Ukraine.

title.info: Congratulations to Alexander Lukashenko, President of the Republic of Belarus
briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his congratulations to President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko on Independence Day, which this year coincides with the 70th anniversary of the liberation of Belarus from Nazi occupation.

title.info: Visit to Belarus to mark the 70th anniversary of the liberation of Belarus from Nazi occupation
briefs: Vladimir Putin visited Minsk, where together with the President of the Republic of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko he took part in events to commemorate the 70th anniversary of the liberation of Belarus from Nazi occupation. The President of Russia spoke at the opening of a new building for the Belarus State Museum of the History of the Great Patriotic War and met with veterans. The two presidents also laid flowers at the Hero City of Minsk monument and the Victory Memorial. Mr Putin’s working visit to Belarus also included talks with President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko.

title.info: Russian-Belarusian talks
briefs: Vladimir Putin and President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko held talks during Mr Putin’s working visit to Belarus.

title.info: 70th anniversary of the liberation of Belarus from Nazi occupation
briefs: Vladimir Putin arrived in Minsk to take part in events commemorating the 70th anniversary of the liberation of Belarus from Nazi occupation.

title.info: Speech at a ceremony marking the opening of a new building for the Belarus State Museum of the History of the Great Patriotic War
briefs: NA

title.info: Meeting with permanent members of the Security Council
briefs: Vladimir Putin held a briefing session with permanent members of the Security Council.

title.info: Conference of Russian ambassadors and permanent representatives
briefs: Vladimir Putin took part in a conference of Russian Federation ambassadors and permanent representatives on protecting Russia’s national interests and strengthening the foundations and principles of international relations.

title.info: Condolences to Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu
briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his condolences to Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Angela Merkel, Francois Hollande and Petro Poroshenko
briefs: As agreed on June 29, Vladimir Putin had another telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel, President of France Francois Hollande, and President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko.

title.info: Law ratifying Russia-Kazakhstan agreement on good-neighbourliness and alliance in the 21st century
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Kazakhstan on Good-Neighbourliness and Alliance in the 21st Century.

title.info: Law ratifying Russia-Armenia agreement on cooperation in supplies of gas, petroleum products and uncut diamonds to Armenia
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Armenia on Cooperation in Supplies of Natural Gas, Petroleum Products and Uncut Diamonds to the Republic of Armenia.

title.info: Law ratifying Russia-Armenia agreement on military technical cooperation
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Armenia on the Development of Military Technical Cooperation.

title.info: Vladimir Putin will visit Belarus on July 2
briefs: At the invitation of President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko, Vladimir Putin will visit Minsk on July 2 to take part in celebrations commemorating the 70th anniversary of the liberation of Belarus from Nazi occupation.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Angela Merkel, Francois Hollande and Petro Poroshenko
briefs: Vladimir Putin took part in a lengthy telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel, President of France Francois Hollande and President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko, during which the four leaders exchanged views on various aspects of the crisis in Ukraine.

title.info: An updated edition of the White Book on human rights violations in Ukraine has been published
briefs: Russia’s Foreign Ministry has prepared an updated edition of the White Book on human rights violations in Ukraine, covering the period from April to mid-June 2014.

title.info: Vladimir Putin will address a conference of Russian Federation ambassadors and permanent representatives on July 1
briefs: The conference’s main theme will be defending Russia’s national interests and strengthening the foundations and principles of international relations.

title.info: Presentation of letters of credence by foreign ambassadors
briefs: Vladimir Putin received letters of credence from 14 new ambassadors to the Russian Federation. The ceremony took place in the Grand Kremlin Palace’s Alexander Hall.

title.info: On June 27 Vladimir Putin will receive letters of credence from fourteen new ambassadors
briefs: On June 27, Vladimir Putin will receive the letters of credence from fourteen new ambassadors to the Russian Federation. Following tradition, the ceremony will be held in the Alexander Hall of the Grand Kremlin Palace.

title.info: Telephone conversation with German Federal Chancellor Angela Merkel
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Angela Merkel, Francois Hollande and Petro Poroshenko
briefs: Vladimir Putin had another telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel and President of France Francois Hollande, with participation by President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko.

title.info: Meeting with President of the State of Palestine Mahmoud Abbas
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with President of the State of Palestine Mahmoud Abbas, who is in Russia on a working visit, at his Novo-Ogaryovo residence near Moscow.

title.info: Meeting with Government members
briefs: Vladimir Putin held a meeting with Government members. The meeting addressed issues pertaining to organisation of transportation and development of communication services in Crimea, as well as the problem of taking care of refugees fleeing conflict zone in Ukraine. Ways to encourage low-income housing construction and the creation of institution of non-profit housing rental were discussed separately.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu
briefs: At Israel’s initiative, Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu.

title.info: Official visit to Austria
briefs: Vladimir Putin held talks with President of the Republic of Austria Heinz Fischer. The two presidents attended the signing of an Agreement on mutual assistance following natural and industrial disasters and cooperation in preventing them. Later, Vladimir Putin and Heinz Fischer made press statements and answered journalists’ questions. Also, the Russian President met with Austrian Federal Chancellor Werner Faymann, President of the Swiss Confederation and Chairperson-in-Office of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) Didier Burkhalter, and Austrian business community leaders. Mr Putin also took part in a wreath-laying ceremony at the monument to Soviet soldiers who fell in the liberation of Austria from Nazism.

title.info: Meeting with Didier Burkhalter
briefs: Vladimir Putin met in Vienna with President of the Swiss Confederation and Chairperson-in-Office of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) Didier Burkhalter.

title.info: Wreath-laying ceremony at the monument to Soviet soldiers who fell in the liberation of Austria from Nazism
briefs: Vladimir Putin took part in a wreath-laying ceremony at the monument to Soviet soldiers who fell in the liberation of Austria from Nazism. The memorial is located on Schwarzenbergplatz in central Vienna.

title.info: Russian-Austrian talks
briefs: Russian-Austrian talks took place in Vienna within the framework of Vladimir Putin’s official visit to Austria.

title.info: Press statements and answers to journalists’ questions following Russian-Austrian talks
briefs: NA

title.info: Statements for the press before Russian-Austrian talks
briefs: NA

title.info: Proposal to Federation Council to repeal resolution to use Russian Armed Forces in Ukraine
briefs: Vladimir Putin has submitted a proposal to the Federation Council to repeal its Resolution on the use of the Russian Armed Forces on the territory of Ukraine.

title.info: Instruction on signing Russia-Abkhazia agreement on transfer of sentenced persons
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Instruction On Signing the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Abkhazia on the Transfer of Sentenced Persons.

title.info: Executive Order to award President’s Certificate of Merit to Peter Sixl
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed an executive order to award a Certificate of Merit from the President of the Russian Federation to Peter Sixl, a citizen of the Austrian Republic and active historian, for his contribution to immortalising the memory of the Soviet citizens who died on Austrian territory during World War II.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of the United States Barack Obama
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of the United States Barack Obama in accordance with a previously-reached agreement.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev.

title.info: Greetings to the 5th Russian-Azerbaijani Forum Interregional Cooperation: New Opportunities for Growth
briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his greetings to the 5th Russian-Azerbaijani Forum Interregional Cooperation: New Opportunities for Growth.

title.info: On the start of contacts with Ukraine’s Choice public movement in Donetsk and Lugansk
briefs: Vladimir Putin welcomed the news that the Ukraine’s Choice public movement has started making contacts in Donetsk and Lugansk. Ukraine’s Choice is led by Viktor Medvedchuk, who has consistently supported the idea of federalism in Ukraine. At the same time he is a respected figure in Kiev and is known in the West.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Angela Merkel and Francois Hollande
briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel and President of France Francois Hollande, as had been arranged by earlier agreement. The three leaders exchanged views on ways to resolve the serious internal political crisis in Ukraine.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko.

briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his congratulations to Abdel Fattah el-Sisi on his inauguration as President of the Arab Republic of Egypt.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Russian veterans of WWII.

briefs: Following the celebrations to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day in Normandy, Vladimir Putin answered questions from journalists.

title.info: Celebrating the 70th anniversary of D-Day
briefs: Following an official breakfast hosted by the French President, Vladimir Putin took part in celebrations to mark the 70th anniversary of the allied forces’ D-Day landing in Normandy.

title.info: Meeting with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel.

title.info: Meeting with President of France Francois Hollande
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with President of France Francois Hollande at the Elysee Palace.

title.info: Visit to France. 70th anniversary of the allied forces’ D-Day landing in Normandy
briefs: In Paris, Vladimir Putin held talks with President of France François Hollande. The President of Russia also met with Prime Minister of Great Britain David Cameron. On the second day of the visit, in Deauville, the Russian President met with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel. Then at Ouistreham, Vladimir Putin attended celebrations to mark the 70th anniversary of the allied forces’ D-Day landing in Normandy. Also, the President of Russia had a meeting with Russian veterans – participants in World War II. During the events in Normandy, Vladimir Putin also spoke to the heads of a number of foreign states.

title.info: Meeting with Prime Minister of the United Kingdom David Cameron
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Prime Minister of the United Kingdom David Cameron.

title.info: Vladimir Putin arrived in France
briefs: In Paris, Vladimir Putin will meet with President of France Francois Hollande and hold talks with Prime Minister of the United Kingdom David Cameron.

title.info: Vladimir Putin’s interview with Radio Europe 1 and TF1 TV channel
briefs: In the run-up to his visit to France, Vladimir Putin gave an interview to Radio Europe 1 news programme author and frontman Jean-Pierre Elkabbach and anchor of the evening news on TF1 TV channel Gilles Bouleau. The interview was recorded on June 3 in Sochi.

title.info: Executive Order on awards to citizens of other states
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Executive Order On National Awards of the Russian Federation to Foreign Citizens.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel.

briefs: At Russia’s initiative, Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Abdel Fattah El-Sisi, who won the absolute majority of votes in the presidential election in the Arab Republic of Egypt.

briefs: At Turkey’s initiative, Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan to discuss international issues and prospects for developing bilateral relations.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with President of Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev.

briefs: After the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council meeting in Astana, President of Russia Vladimir Putin, President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev and President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko signed the Treaty on the Eurasian Economic Union.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Azerbaijan on Republic Day
briefs: Vladimir Putin congratulated President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev on the country’s national holiday, Republic Day.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Italy Matteo Renzi.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with former Prime Minister of India Manmohan Singh.

briefs: The Presidential Civil Service and Personnel Directorate held a meeting with a Chinese delegation headed by Chinese Deputy Human Resources and Social Security Minister Yang Zhiming.

briefs: The Supreme Eurasian Economic Council will meet in Astana, Kazakhstan on May 29.

briefs: At the initiative of his West European partners, Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel and President of France Francois Hollande.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Prime Minister of Mongolia Norovyn Altankhuyag.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Narendra Modi, leader of India’s Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which won the recent Indian general election.

briefs: Vladimir Putin congratulated Jacob Zuma on his reelection as President of the Republic of South Africa.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with President of the Islamic Republic of Iran Hassan Rouhani. The two leaders met on the sidelines of the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia summit.

briefs: Vladimir Putin took part in the plenary session at the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA) summit.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with the President of Mongolia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with former President of China Jiang Zemin.

briefs: At Finland’s initiative, Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of Finland Sauli Niinistö.

briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his condolences to President of the Republic of Colombia Juan Manuel Santos Calderon following an accident that killed children in the north of the country.

briefs: NA

briefs: Before leaving for China, Vladimir Putin held a briefing session with permanent members of the Security Council.

briefs: Vladimir Putin congratulated Narendra Modi on the Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) victory in India’s general election.

briefs: Ahead of the official visit to the People’s Republic of China, Vladimir Putin gave an interview to China's leading media companies.

briefs: At Russia’s initiative, Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

briefs: Vladimir Putin had a working meeting with Governor of Orenburg Region Yury Berg to discuss the region’s socioeconomic situation, spring sowing campaign, and cooperation with the neighbouring regions in Kazakhstan as part of deepening Eurasian integration.

briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his condolences to President of Turkey Abdullah Gul and Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan following a devastating mine accident in the town of Soma.

briefs: Vladimir Putin met with President of Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev to discuss joint projects and ways of deepening cooperation within the integration process.

briefs: Vladimir Putin and President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan discussed pressing issues of bilateral cooperation.

briefs: The President of Russia and the President of Belarus discussed bilateral cooperation, interaction within integration unions and the situation in Ukraine.

title.info: On May 7, Vladimir Putin will meet in Moscow with President of Switzerland and OSCE Chairperson-in-Office Didier Burkhalter
briefs: The meeting is expected to focus on the crisis in Ukraine.

title.info: Working visit to the Vatican and Italy
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Pope Francis and the Hole See’s Secretary of State Pietro Parolin during a brief visit to the Vatican. In Rome, Mr Putin had talks with President of Italy Giorgio Napolitano and also met with former Italian Prime Minister and UN Special Envoy for the Sahel Romano Prodi.   In Trieste, Mr Putin and Italian Prime Minister Enrico Letta chaired expanded Russian-Italian interstate consultations and witnessed the signing of a package of cooperation agreements following the consultations. The two leaders also made press statements and answered journalists’ questions.   The President also addressed the closing session of a business forum held as part of the Russian-Italian civil society dialogue forum.

title.info: G20 summit
briefs: Vladimir Putin took part in the working sessions of G20 leaders. The President of Russia met with President of China Xi Jinping, Prime Minister of Japan Shinzo Abe, Prime Minister of Italy Enrico Letta, British Prime Minister David Cameron, President of the United States Barack Obama, Prime Minister of Spain Mariano Rajoy, and President of South Korea Park Geun-hye on the summit’s sidelines. During the summit, G20 leaders also met with representatives of the Business 20 (B20) and Labour 20 (L20). In addition, Vladimir Putin took part in the meeting of heads of state and government of BRICS countries. Following the G20 summit the President of Russia gave a news conference.

title.info: Working dinner with G20 summit participants
briefs: The heads of the G20 member state delegations, invited nations and international organisations arrived at Peterhof for a working dinner to discuss the Syrian peace process, among other topics.

title.info: Visit to Kazakhstan. Meeting of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council
briefs: Vladimir Putin, together with President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko and President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev, took part in a meeting of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council. President of Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev and President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych also attended the meeting, which concluded with the signing of a package of documents. After the meeting, the presidents of Russia, Kazakhstan, Belarus, Ukraine and Kyrgyzstan visited the State Opera and Ballet Theatre Astana Opera, currently under construction.

title.info: Meeting of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council
briefs: Vladimir Putin, President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko and President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev took part in a meeting of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council (SEEC), the highest body of the Customs Union and the Common Economic Space formed by Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan. President of Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev and President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych also attended the meeting.

title.info: Vladimir Putin arrived in Astana to attend a Supreme Eurasian Economic Council meeting

The Council is the supreme body of the Customs Union and Common Economic Space between Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan.

An exchange of views on Russia’s Armed Forces’ organisation and development also took place, and the meeting examined domestic and external security issues.

title.info: Meeting with permanent members of the Security Council
briefs: Vladimir Putin discussed with the Security Council’s permanent members current socio-economic issues and the international situation, including in the context of the discussions underway at the UN General Assembly. Mr Putin also raised the question of taking urgent measures to combat drunk driving.

title.info: Working trip to Primorye. APEC Leaders' Week
briefs: During the trip to the Primorye Territory, Vladimir Putin visited a number of urban infrastructure facilities built for the APEC forum, in particular the new terminal and airport refuelling complex at the Vladivostok Knevichi International Airport. The President also took part in laying the first stone of Rosneft Eastern Petrochemical Plant and opened a Mazda car assembly line in Vladivostok. At the APEC forum, Vladimir Putin took part in APEC Leaders’ Week working sessions, in the plenary session of the APEC CEO Summit and met with members of the Business Advisory Council. The Russian President held a series of bilateral meetings on the sidelines of the summit. Following the APEC summit, Vladimir Putin met with the heads of the Far East Federal District and the Far East Federal University, and presented the university with the symbolic key to the new campus.

briefs: In the run-up to the APEC Forum, Vladimir Putin gave an interview to Russia Today TV Channel.

title.info: St Petersburg International Economic Forum
briefs: The XVI St Petersburg International Economic Forum has officially opened. The forum’s theme this year is Effective Leadership, which is also at the focus of Vladimir Putin's address at the forum’s plenary session.

title.info: Congratulations to Antonis Samaras on his victory in the parliamentary elections in Greece and his appointment as Prime Minister
briefs: Vladimir Putin congratulated Antonis Samaras on the victory of the New Democracy party in the elections to the Parliament of the Hellenic Republic and on his appointment as Prime Minister of Greece.

title.info: Congratulations to Salman Bin Abdul-Aziz Al Saud on appointment as Crown Prince
briefs: Vladimir Putin congratulated Salman Bin Abdul-Aziz Al Saud on being appointed Crown Price, Deputy Prime Minister and Defence Minister of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title.info: G20 Summit
briefs: A meeting of G20 heads of state and government was held in Los Cabos, Mexico. Vladimir Putin headed the Russian delegation at the summit.

title.info: Meeting with President of Indonesia Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono
briefs: Vladimir Putin met on the sidelines of the G20 Summit with President of Indonesia Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono for talks that focused in particular on developing bilateral trade and economic relations.

title.info: Meeting with Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan
briefs: Vladimir Putin met with Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan on the sidelines of the G20 Summit.

title.info: Meeting with President of Brazil Dilma Rousseff
briefs: Vladimir Putin held a meeting with President of Brazil Dilma Rousseff at the G20 summit.

briefs: NA

title.info: Vladimir Putin will make working visits to Israel, Palestine and Jordan on June 25-26
briefs: NA

title.info: The G20 and global economic challenges
briefs: An article by Vladimir Putin, published by the Mexican daily El Universal, covers the global economic issues and new challenges facing the G20.

title.info: G20 Summit
briefs: Vladimir Putin took part in the G20 summit meetings. The President had a number of meetings on the summit’s sidelines too, including talks with President of the United States Barack Obama, Japanese Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda, British Prime Minister David Cameron, Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff, Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan, and President of Indonesia Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono. Mr Putin also took part in the meeting of BRICS leaders.

title.info: Condolences to King of Saudi Arabia Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud
briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his condolences to King of Saudi Arabia Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud following the death of Crown Prince Nayef.

briefs: NA

briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Protocol to the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the European Space Agency on the Establishment of a Permanent Mission of the European Space Agency in the Russian Federation and its Status of April 10, 1995.

title.info: Law on ratification of agreement between Russia and Poland on the local cross-border travel regime
briefs: Vladimir Putin signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Poland on the Local Cross-Border Travel Regime.

title.info: Condolences to President of Afghanistan Hamid Karzai
briefs: Vladimir Putin sent his condolences to President of Afghanistan Hamid Karzai following the earthquake in the province of Baghlan.

title.info: Vladimir Putin will take part in the G20 summit
briefs: On June 18 and 19, President Putin will attend a meeting of the G20 heads of state and government in Los Cabos, Mexico.

title.info: Official visit to Kazakhstan
briefs: Vladimir Putin and President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev held talks in Astana. A set of documents was signed following the meeting; in particular, the presidents signed a Protocol on Amendments to the 1992 Agreement on Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance, which extends the agreement for ten years, taking into account the new realities of political and economic integration between Russia and Kazakhstan.

title.info: Visit to Uzbekistan
briefs: Vladimir Putin held talks with President of Uzbekistan Islam Karimov. Following the meeting, the two presidents signed a Declaration on Further Consolidation of Strategic Partnership and a Memorandum of Understanding on further joint measures for Uzbekistan’s accession to the Free Trade Zone Agreement. Russian President also answered to journalists’ questions following visit to Uzbekistan.

title.info: Visit to Uzbekistan
briefs: Vladimir Putin held talks with President of Uzbekistan Islam Karimov. Following the meeting, the two presidents signed a Declaration on Further Consolidation of Strategic Partnership and a Memorandum of Understanding on further joint measures for Uzbekistan’s accession to the Free Trade Zone Agreement.

briefs: President Vladimir Putin and Prime Minister of Russia Dmitry Medvedev discussed bilateral relations and plans for future contacts during a meeting with Ukrainian Prime Minister Mykola Azarov. The meeting was held on the sidelines of the United Russia party congress.

briefs: A meeting of the CSTO Collective Security Council dedicated to 20th anniversary of the Collective Security Treaty and 10th anniversary of CSTO will take place in Moscow on May 15, 2012.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Singapore on the Promotion and Reciprocal Protection of Investments.

title.info: Condolences to President and Prime Minister of India
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message of condolences to India’s President Pratibha Patil and Prime Minister Manmohan Singh over the loss of life following a ferry accident.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and  Li Keqiang discussed prospects for developing bilateral cooperation.

title.info: Order on decorating foreign veterans of World War II with the Ushakov Medal
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Executive Order On Awarding the Ushakov Medal to Citizens of Australia, New Zealand, and the United States of America.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev will meet with Vice Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China Li Keqiang on April 27, 2012.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held an expanded meeting of the State Council.

title.info: Condolences to President of Pakistan Asif Ali Zardari
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to President of Pakistan Asif Ali Zardari following a plane crash near Islamabad.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev met with Russian and Italian Foreign and Defence ministers
briefs: Taking part in the meeting were Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, Russian Defence Minister Anatoly Serdyukov, Italian Foreign Minister Giulio Terzi, and Italian Defence Minister Giampaolo Di Paola.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of South Ossetia Leonid Tibilov
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of the Republic of South Ossetia Leonid Tibilov.

title.info: Agreement between Russia and Italy on transit of military cargo submitted for ratification to State Duma
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev submitted to the State Duma for ratification the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Italian Republic on the air transit of weapons, ammunition, military equipment, military assets and personnel via Russian Federation territory in connection with participation by Armed Forces of the Italian Republic in efforts to stabilise and rehabilitate the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, signed in Rome on February 16, 2011.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of South Africa Jacob Zuma
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated the South African leader on his 70th birthday. The heads of state expressed mutual satisfaction with the high level of understanding and cooperation achieved between Russia and South Africa, both in bilateral affairs and in multilateral formats. In this context, the two leaders gave a very positive assessment of the recent BRICS summit in New Delhi and the Russian-South African high-level talks held within its framework.

title.info: Congratulations to Leonid Tibilov on his election as President of South Ossetia
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message to Leonid Tibilov congratulating him on being elected President of the Republic of South Ossetia.

title.info: Agreement on forming and functioning of forces and weapons of the CSTO collective security system submitted to State Duma for ratification
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev submitted to the State Duma for ratification the Agreement on Forming and Functioning of Forces and Weapons of the Collective Security System of CSTO Member States, which was signed in Moscow on December 10, 2010.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message to President of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov congratulating him on the 20th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the Russian Federation and Turkmenistan and the 10th anniversary of the signing of the bilateral Agreement on Friendship and Cooperation.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message to President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon congratulating him on the 20th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Tajikistan.

title.info: Law increasing administrative liability for violating international road haulage regulations
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Amendments to the Code of Administrative Offences of the Russian Federation and Article 11 of the Federal Law On State Control over International Road Haulage and Liability for Violating Relevant Regulations.

title.info: Law on ratification of agreement on the use of CIS interstate electricity transmission lines
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement on Cooperation between Member States of the Commonwealth of Independent States on the Use of Interstate Transmission Lines of National Power Grids.

title.info: Law on ratification of agreement between Russia and Ukraine on opening cultural and information centres in Moscow and Kiev
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine on the Establishment and Activity of Cultural and Information Centres.

title.info: Law on ratification of the Russian-Belarusian agreement on traffic control on the border of the Union State
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Republic of Belarus on the Implementation of Traffic (Vehicle) Control on the External Border of the Union State.

title.info: Law on ratification of the agreement on free trade zone in the CIS
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement on the Free Trade Zone.

title.info: Law on ratification of the Protocol on Amendments to the Russian-Italian Convention on Taxation
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Protocol on Amendments to the Convention between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the Italian Republic on the Avoidance of Double Taxation with Respect to Taxes on Income and Capital and Prevention of Fiscal Evasion of April 9, 1996.

title.info: Message to Alexander Lukashenko on the Day of Unity between the Peoples of the Russian Federation and the Republic of Belarus
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message of congratulations to President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko on the Day of Unity between the Peoples of the Russian Federation and the Republic of Belarus.

title.info: Instructions to Government Cabinet on providing assistance to Tajikistan
briefs: Following the appeal by the President of Tajikistan, Dmitry Medvedev instructed the Government of the Russian Federation to provide emergency humanitarian assistance to Tajikistan to overcome the effects of abnormal winter weather conditions.

briefs: NA

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Manmohan Singh reviewed the progress made in implementing existing agreements and outlined the development prospects for Russian-Indian cooperation.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held a meeting with President of Brazil Dilma Rousseff.

title.info: BRICS Summit
briefs: The Fourth BRICS Summit has concluded in New Delhi. The leaders of Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa taking part in the Summit exchanged views on the situation in the global economy, reforms of global management institutions, international stability and security issues.

title.info: Russian President's address at the BRICS Summit
briefs: NA

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev received honorary Doctor of Philosophy degree from Jawaharlal Nehru University
briefs: NA

title.info: BRICS Summit
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev took part in the Fourth BRICS Summit in New Delhi. The Summit resulted in signing of a number of joint documents. On the sidelines of the Summit, President Medvedev held meetings with President of South Africa Jacob Zuma, President of the People’s Republic of China Hu Jintao, President of Brazil Dilma Rousseff, and Prime Minister of India Manmohan Singh.

title.info: Meeting with President of the People’s Republic of China Hu Jintao
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Hu Jintao discussed prospects for developing bilateral cooperation and exchanged views on current regional and international issues.

title.info: Meeting with President of South Africa Jacob Zuma
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev met with President of South Africa Jacob Zuma in New Delhi, where the two leaders will take part in the BRICS summit. The meeting between the leaders of Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa will take place on March 29, 2012.

title.info: Nuclear Security Summit
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev attended the Nuclear Security Summit. On the Summit’s sidelines, the Russian President had meetings with President of the United States Barack Obama, President of the Republic of Korea Lee Myung-bak, Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan, and King Abdullah II of Jordan. The presidents of Kazakhstan, Russia and the United States made a joint statement on trilateral cooperation on the former Semipalatinsk nuclear test site.

title.info: News conference following the Nuclear Security Summit
briefs: NA

title.info: Procedures have been approved for implementing an agreement between Russia and Belarus on developing military technical cooperation
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Executive Order On Approving the Procedures for Implementing the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Belarus on Developing Military Technical Cooperation of December 10, 2009.

title.info: Meeting with King Abdullah II of Jordan
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held talks with King Abdullah II of Jordan.

title.info: Nuclear Security Summit
briefs: The second Nuclear Security Summit was held in Seoul, dedicated to national measures and international cooperation in strengthening nuclear security.

title.info: Meeting with Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held talks with Prime Minister of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title.info: Statement by Presidents of Kazakhstan, Russia and the United States on cooperation on the former Semipalatinsk nuclear test range
briefs: Nursultan Nazarbayev, Dmitry Medvedev and Barack Obama commented on the joint statement on trilateral cooperation on the former Semipalatinsk nuclear test site.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Algeria Abdelaziz Bouteflika
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent congratulations to President of the People’s Democratic Republic of Algeria Abdelaziz Bouteflika on the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Algeria and Russia.

title.info: Meeting with President of the Republic of Korea Lee Myung-bak
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held talks with South Korean President Lee Myung-bak. The two leaders discussed opportunities for developing Russian-Korean relations.

title.info: Meeting with President of the United States Barack Obama
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev met with US President Barack Obama in Seoul, where the two leaders are attending a nuclear security summit.

briefs: Mr Medvedev and Mr Annan discussed the situation in Syria.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated Nikolae Timofti on his election as President of the Republic of Moldova.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev will take part in the BRICS Summit
briefs: On March 28-29, Dmitry Medvedev will take part in a meeting of the leaders of Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa, which will be held in New Delhi.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Iraq Nouri al-Maliki.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with King of Saudi Arabia Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Silvio Berlusconi.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev took part in the APEC CEO Summit
briefs: The President of Russia answered questions from summit participants, including about Russia's accession to the WTO, the prospects for economic cooperation with Japan, increasing deliveries of Russian gas to China, and measures to stabilise the situation in the eurozone.

title.info: Meeting with President of Indonesia Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono discussed further development of their countries' bilateral relations.

title.info: Meeting with US President Barack Obama
briefs: Talks between Dmitry Medvedev and US President Barack Obama were held on the sidelines of the APEC summit in Honolulu.

title.info: Meeting with Japanese Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda
briefs: During their conversation, Dmitry Medvedev and Yoshihiko Noda paid particular attention to cooperation in the energy sector. The Russian party confirmed its willingness to increase aid to Japan to help the country overcome the consequences of the accident at the Fukushima 1 Nuclear Power Plant.

title.info: Meeting with President of Vietnam Truong Tan Sang
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev discussed with President of Vietnam Truong Tan Sang the prospects for bilateral cooperation in nuclear energy, as well as further cooperation in the fields of oil and gas, research and development, education, and culture.

title.info: Meeting with Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev discussed with Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak the prospects for expanding trade and economic cooperation between the two countries.

title.info: Meeting with representatives of Asia-Pacific business communities
briefs: On the sidelines of the APEC Summit, Dmitry Medvedev held an informal meeting with representatives of Asia-Pacific business communities. The Russian President told the business leaders about Russia’s anti-crisis policy with an emphasis on modernisation and innovation-driven economic growth, as well as the measures to improve the investment climate.

title.info: Meeting with Prime Minister of Australia Julia Gillard
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Prime Minister of Australia Julia Gillard discussed ways to overcome the global economic crisis and cooperation in the Asia-Pacific Region.

title.info: Meeting with President of Peru Ollanta Humala
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Ollanta Humala discussed the main issues on the Russian-Peruvian agenda and cooperation in the international arena.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev, President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko and President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev will meet on November 18 in Moscow
briefs: The heads of the Customs Union member states will discuss current issues of integration in the Eurasian region pending entry into force on January 1, 2012, of a package of treaties forming a Common Economic Space between the three nations.

title.info: Meeting with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Angela Merkel discussed trade and economic cooperation and humanitarian ties.

title.info: Meeting with German business community leaders
briefs: In Berlin Dmitry Medvedev met with German business community leaders, including executives of Siemens, Deutsche Bank, E.ON, Ruhrgas, Metro, Knauf and others.

title.info: Congratulations to President of the Republic of Nicaragua Daniel Ortega Saavedra
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated Daniel Ortega Saavedra on his reelection as President of the Republic of Nicaragua.

title.info: Launch ceremony for Nord Stream gas pipeline
briefs: In Lubmin, Germany, Dmitry Medvedev and Federal Chancellor Angela Merkel took part in the launch ceremony for the first leg of the Nord Stream gas pipeline.

title.info: Meeting with President of the Federal Republic of Germany Christian Wulff
briefs: In Berlin, Dmitry Medvedev met with President of the Federal Republic of Germany Christian Wulff.

title.info: Executive order on the Foreign Ministry’s coordinating role in conducting a uniform foreign policy
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Executive Order On  Coordinating Role of the Foreign Ministry of the Russian Federation in Conducting a Uniform Foreign Policy of the Russian Federation.

title.info: Visit to Germany. Opening of the Nord Stream gas pipeline
briefs: During his official visit to Germany Dmitry Medvedev had a meeting with Federal President Christian Wulff, followed by a joint news conference. President Medvedev also took part in the ceremony inaugurating the launch of the first line of the Nord Stream gas pipeline, met with German business community leaders, and had a meeting with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel.

title.info: Meeting with the G20 Trade Unions Summit delegates
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev met with trade union leaders from the G20 countries.

title.info: G20 Summit
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev took part in a working meeting of the G20 heads of state and government.

title.info: News briefing following G20 Summit
briefs: NA

title.info: G20 Business Summit
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev's address at the G20 Business Summit

title.info: Meeting with President of China Hu Jintao
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev met with President of the People's Republic of China Hu Jintao on the sidelines of the G20 Summit.

title.info: BRICS Summit
briefs: NA

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev's message to the G20 leaders
briefs: The President of Russia addressed the leaders of the G20 member states on a new concept concerning the use and protection of the results of intellectual activities on the Internet.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev will make an official visit to Germany
briefs: The President will make an official visit to the Federal Republic of Germany on November 7-8. The visit will take place at the invitation of President of Federal Republic of Germany Christian Wulff.

title.info: Russia-Republic of Korea Dialogue forum
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev spoke at the closing plenary session of the Russia-Republic of Korea Dialogue forum in St Petersburg.

title.info: Congratulations to Kyrgyzstan's President-elect Almazbek Atambayev
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated President-elect of the Kyrgyz Republic Almazbek Atambayev on winning the presidential elections.

title.info: Telephone conversation with King Abdullah II of Jordan
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with King Abdullah II of Jordan.

title.info: Meeting with President of Switzerland Micheline Calmy-Rey
briefs: Russia’s accession to the WTO was the main subject on the agenda at Dmitry Medvedev’s talks with President of Switzerland Micheline Calmy-Rey. The two presidents also discussed bilateral cooperation.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev on Azerbaijan’s election as a non-permanent member of the United Nations Security Council in 2012-2013.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated President of the Republic of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov on Independence Day, the country’s national holiday.

title.info: Telephone conversations with presidents of Kazakhstan and Belarus
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had telephone conversations with President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev and President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his greetings to the participants and guests of the International Scientific Forum Kazakhstan and the Eurasian Idea in the New World.

title.info: Instruction on fulfilling Russia's obligations under existing intergovernmental agreements
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed instructions on fulfilling Russia's obligations under existing intergovernmental agreements

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of Turkey Abdullah Gul
briefs: At Russia’s initiative, Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Turkey Abdullah Gul.

title.info: Russian-Armenian talks
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan discussed a wide range of bilateral economic cooperation and military-technical cooperation issues, and various aspects of their work together in regional forums, in particular the Collective Security Treaty Organisation.

title.info: Beginning of talks with President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan
briefs: NA

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev will meet with President of South Korea Lee Myung-bak
briefs: At the invitation of Dmitry Medvedev, President of the Republic of Korea Lee Myung-bak will make a working visit to Russia on November 1-2.

title.info: Condolences to President of Turkey following the earthquake
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to President of Turkey Abdullah Gul and the entire Turkish people following a devastating earthquake.

title.info: Condolences to King of Saudi Arabia Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to King of Saudi Arabia Abdullah bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud following the death of Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Sultan bin Abdul Aziz al-Saud.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Nursultan Nazarbayev
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev.

title.info: Laws on ratification of agreements with some states on reciprocal travel by citizens
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed a number of laws ratifying agreements with foreign states on reciprocal travel by citizens.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held talks with Prime Minister of the Netherlands Mark Rutte, who is in Russia on an official visit.

title.info: Agreement on functioning of the Customs Union within the multilateral trade system framework
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of Agreement on Functioning of the Customs Union within the Multilateral Trade System Framework.

title.info: Law on customs tariffs payment procedures when exporting from Belarus petrol and certain categories of petrol derivatives
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of Agreement on Payment and Enrolment Procedures for Export Customs Tariffs (and Other Equivalent Tariffs, Taxes and Duties) When Exporting from the Territory of the Republic of Belarus Beyond the Customs Union’s Customs Territory Raw Petrol and Certain Categories of Goods Produced from Petrol.

title.info: Amendments to Russian-Chinese agreement on cooperation in the petrol sector
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of Protocol on Amendments to the Agreement between the Government of the Russian Federation and the Government of the People’s Republic of China on Cooperation in the Petrol Sector of April 21, 2009.

title.info: Protocol on amendments to Collective Security Treaty
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Protocol on Amendments to the Collective Security Treaty of May 15, 1992.

briefs: NA

title.info: Second Russian-Ukrainian Interregional Economic Forum
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev took part in the Second Russian-Ukrainian Interregional Economic Forum in Donetsk, which focussed on regional cooperation in science, technology and production.

title.info: Congratulatory message to President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a congratulatory message to President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev on the 20th anniversary of his nation’s independence.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev will receive President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan at the Kremlin
briefs: President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan will make a state visit to Russia on October 23-25, 2011 at Dmitry Medvedev’s invitation.

title.info: Greetings to participants of the World Conference of Compatriots
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his greetings to participants of the World Conference of Compatriots.

title.info: Meeting with members of the Security Council
briefs: International energy cooperation was the subject of discussion.

title.info: Telephone conversation with President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko.

title.info: Prime Minister of the Netherlands Mark Rutte will make an official visit to Russia on October 19-21
briefs: NA

title.info: Meeting with President of Laos Choummaly Sayasone
briefs: Following the Russian-Lao talks, the two leaders adopted a declaration on strategic partnership in the Asia-Pacific region between Russia and the Lao People's Democratic Republic. A number of other documents, in particular, an agreement on cooperation in healthcare and tourism, were signed in the presence of Dmitry Medvedev and Choummaly Sayasone.

title.info: Sergei Naryshkin met with Prime Minister of Kyrgyzstan Almazbek Atambayev
briefs: Chief of Staff of the Presidential Executive Office Sergei Naryshkin met with Kyrgyz Prime Minister and presidential candidate Almazbek Atambayev.

title.info: Russian-Ukrainian Economic Forum to be held in Donetsk
briefs: The Second Russian-Ukrainian Interregional Economic Forum will be held in Donetsk on October 18, 2011.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent greetings to participants and guests at the International Humanitarian Forum in Baku.

title.info: Order on holding season of Russian language and literature in France and French language and literature in Russia
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed an order on holding the Season of Russian Language and Literature in the French Republic and the Season of French Language and Literature in the Russian Federation in 2012.

title.info: Meeting with Security Council members
briefs: The meeting discussed, in particular, the United Nations Security Council draft resolution on Syria, which was vetoed by Russia during the recent vote in the UN Security Council.

title.info: Russian-Abkhazian talks
briefs: Talks between Dmitry Medvedev and President of Abkhazia Alexander Ankvab took place in the Kremlin.

title.info: Agreement with South Ossetia on a unified Russian military base in the republic
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of South Ossetia on a Unified Russian Military Base in the Republic of South Ossetia.

title.info: Agreement with Abkhazia on a unified Russian military base in the republic
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Federal Law On Ratification of the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Abkhazia on a Unified Russian Military Base in the Republic of Abkhazia.

title.info: President of Laos Choummaly Sayasone will visit Russia
briefs: At Dmitry Medvedev’s invitation, President of the People’s Democratic Republic of Laos Choummaly Sayasone will make an official visit to Russia on October 12-16.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message of congratulations to President of Abkhazia Alexander Ankvab on the republic’s national holiday, Independence Day.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Italy Silvio Berlusconi.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated Prime Minister of Australia Julia Gillard on her birthday.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his greetings to participants of the third Russia-Turkmenistan Economic Forum A New Level of Interregional Cooperation as the Guarantee for a New Quality of Life for the Peoples of Russia and Turkmenistan.

title.info: Condolences to President of Pakistan
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev extended his condolences to President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan Asif Ali Zardari in connection with a tragic road accident in the province of Punjab.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his of congratulations to Michael Sata on his election to the post of president of Zambia.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to President of Afghanistan Hamid Karzai following the killing on September 20 of the head of the High Peace Council of Afghanistan and the country’s former president, Burhanuddin Rabbani.

title.info: Congratulations on Armenia’s Independence Day
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message of congratulations to President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan on the 20th anniversary of Armenia’s independence.

briefs: Dmitry Medevdev submitted to the State Duma for ratification the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of South Ossetia on Customs Cooperation and Mutual Assistance, signed in Moscow on December 9, 2010.

briefs: Sergei Naryshkin attended a parade in honour of South Ossetia's Independence Day.

title.info: Chief of Staff of the Presidential Executive Office attended the opening of the First Russian-South Ossetian Business Forum
briefs: Sergei Naryshkin attended the opening of the First Russian-South Ossetian Business Forum, which gathered the two countries' business leaders in Tskhinval.

title.info: Condolences to Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Thailand
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Thailand Yingluck Shinawatra following the massive human victims and widespread destruction caused by flooding.

title.info: Condolences to the President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan Asif Ali Zardari following the human victims and destruction caused by a massive flood in the Sindh province.

title.info: Condolences to the President of Nepal
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to President of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal Ram Baran Yadav following a deadly earthquake in the country.

title.info: Condolences to the President and Prime Minister of India
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to President of India Pratibha Patil and Prime Minister of India Manmohan Singh following an earthquake that claimed victims and caused damage in the northeast of the country.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People’s Congress Wu Bangguo discussed, in particular, development of Russian-Chinese inter-parliamentary relations.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev took part in the VIII Russia-Kazakhstan Interregional Cooperation Forum. The main item on the agenda is the organisation of the two countries’ joint efforts in cross-border emergency situations.

title.info: Meeting with President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev
briefs: Before the VIII Russia-Kazakhstan Interregional Cooperation Forum, Dmitry Medvedev and Nursultan Nazarbayev reviewed bilateral cooperation issues and the future development of the Customs Union between Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Armenia Serzh Sargsyan.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev expressed his condolences to President of the Republic of Kenya Mwai Kibaki in connection with the many human victims of a pipeline fire in Nairobi.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held talks at the Kremlin with British Prime Minister David Cameron.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his congratulations to President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon on Independence Day, Tajikistan’s national holiday.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his congratulations to Chairman of the National Defence Committee of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea Kim Jong Il on the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.

briefs: The main theme of the Forum was The Modern State in the Age of Social Diversity.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev, HM Queen Margrethe II of Denmark, and HRH Prince Consort Henrik took part in the opening of the Danish-Russian photo exhibition The Arctic at the Moscow House of Photography.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev met with Russian and French foreign and defence ministers.

briefs: NA

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Japan Yoshihiko Noda. The conversation took place at the initiative of the Japanese side.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov discussed the forthcoming visit of Turkmenistan’s leader to Russia, as well as bilateral economic and humanitarian cooperation.

title.info: Anniversary CIS Summit took place in Tajik capital
briefs: The CIS leaders took stock of 20 years of cooperation. After the talks, CIS heads of state adopted a package of documents on cooperation within the CIS, as well as an agreement to perpetuate the memory of the Commonwealth nations that fought in the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945.

title.info: Official visit to Tajikistan
briefs: Russian-Tajikistani talks on bilateral economic, trade, military technical and humanitarian cooperation have taken place in Dushanbe. Issues on the regional and international agendas were also discussed.

title.info: Press statements following Russian-Tajikistani talks
briefs: NA

title.info: Meeting of the Presidents of Russia, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Tajikistan
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev, Hamid Karzai, Asif Ali Zardari, and Emomali Rahmon held a four-party meeting in Dushanbe.

title.info: Congratulations to President of Uzbekistan Islam Karimov
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his congratulations to President of Uzbekistan Islam Karimov on Independence Day, Uzbekistan’s national holiday.

briefs: NA

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev submitted to the State Duma for ratification the Protocol on Amendments to the Collective Security Treaty of May 15, 1992 which was signed in Moscow on December 10, 2010.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of Greece Georgios Papandreou.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his congratulations to President of the Kyrgyz Republic Roza Otunbayeva on the 20th anniversary of Kyrgyzstan’s independence.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Eduard Kokoity discussed the future of bilateral relations and a number of international issues associated with the republic's development.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Federal Chancellor of Germany Angela Merkel.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev held talks with Chairman of the National Defence Committee of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea Kim Jong II.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his congratulations to President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych on Independence Day, Ukraine's national holiday.

briefs: The two presidents discussed various bilateral relations matters, cooperation within the Customs Union, and exchanged views on the main issues on the international agenda.

briefs: Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea Kim Jong Il began a visit to the Russian Federation today.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Uzbekistan Islam Karimov.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with President of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message of congratulations to President of India Pratibha Patil and Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on the country’s national holiday, Independence Day.

title.info: Telephone conversation with former President of Cuba and President of the Council of Ministers Fidel Castro
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev congratulated Fidel Castro on his 85th birthday. Mr Castro thanked Mr Medvedev for the personalised message and passed on his best wishes to the Russian people.

title.info: Executive order on fulfilment of UN Security Council Resolution 1973
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed Executive Order On Measures to Fulfil UN Security Council Resolution 1973 of March 17, 2011. The Resolution establishes a no-fly zone over Libyan airspace and toughens the sanctions imposed on Libya by UN Security Council Resolution 1970 of February 26, 2011.

title.info: Meeting with President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Viktor Yanukovych discussed a wide range of bilateral and regional issues, in particular the prospects for expanding the interregional and border cooperation and the integration processes in the CIS.

title.info: Meeting with President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev and Ilham Aliyev exchanged views on key aspects of Russian-Azerbaijani relations, as well as regional issues, in particular the Nagorno Karabakh peace talks.

title.info: Telephone conversation with Prime Minister of New Zealand John Key
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev had a telephone conversation with Prime Minister of New Zealand John Key.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev will make a working visit to Kazakhstan
briefs: The President will take part in an informal summit of the Collective Security Treaty Organisation member countries.

title.info: Dmitry Medvedev will meet with President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych
briefs: President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych will make a working visit to Sochi on August 11.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev submitted to the State Duma for ratification the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of Abkhazia on an Integrated Russian Military Base on the Republic of Abkhazia’s Territory, signed in Moscow on February 17, 2010.

title.info: Agreement on a Russian military base in South Ossetia has been submitted to the State Duma for ratification
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev submitted to the State Duma for ratification the Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Republic of South Ossetia on an Integrated Russian Military Base on the Republic of South Ossetia’s Territory, signed in Moscow on April 7, 2010.

briefs: NA

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev signed a list of instructions following the joint session of presidiums of Presidential Council for Culture and the Arts and the Presidential Council for Science, Technology and Education, as well as the meeting with historians held on July 22. The joint session was devoted to preparations for celebrating the 1150th anniversary of Russia’s statehood in 2012.

briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent a message to President of the Republic of Peru Ollanta Humala Tasso, congratulating him on assuming presidential office, as well as on Peru’s national holiday, the Independence Day.

briefs: NA

title.info: Condolences to King Mohammed VI of Morocco
briefs: Dmitry Medvedev sent his condolences to King Mohammed VI of Morocco following a plane crash that killed dozens of people.
